title: Speaking Wales' Language (with Rhun ap Iorwerth)
itunes:title: Speaking Wales' Language (with Rhun ap Iorwerth)
description:
Rhun ap Iorwerth, Plaid Cymru's deputy leader and member of the Welsh parliament for Ynys Môn, says the growth of pro-independence support is remarkable. He tells Bloomberg Westminster's Roger Hearing and Caroline Hepker that Wales may be where Scotland was 15 years ago.

And after the Olympics: what did London learn from the 2012 Games in terms of reusing buildings and venues? Gavin Poole, CEO of Here East, says the city should be a model not just for Tokyo but for Paris and Los Angeles, the cities who are about to host the Olympics.
